content: this is a headband i have knitted in one afternoon to match a pullover that s not quite finished yet the finished width in this case is 12 cm / 4 7 in so it might not be suitable for small children unless you use a thinner yarn and smaller needle size as you only need about 100 m / 110 yards this is also quite a nice way to get rid of scrap yarns and leftovers ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ***errata *** i wasn t quite clear in part 2 of the pattern by omitting to mention that you slip the first marker and knit the pattern to the second the 4 pattern row should be like this row 01 k2 p1 k4 p1 sm k1 p1 to 1 st before m k1 sm p1 k4 p1 k2 row 02 k1 p1 k1 p4 k1 sm k1 p1 to 1 st before m k1 sm k1 p4 k1 p1 k1 row 03 k2 p1 c4f p1 sm k1 p1 to 1 st before m k1 sm p1 c4b p1 k2 row 04 same as row 02
